required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Mannitol on Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter in Patients Undergoing Robotic Prostatectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Mannitol on Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter in Patients Undergoing Robot-assisted Laparoscopic Radical Prostatectomy: a Prospective Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: We aim to evaluate the change in optic nerve sheath diameters as a surrogate of intracranial pressure before and after mannitol administration in patients who undergo robot assisted laparoscopic radical prostatectomy with pneumoperitoneum and Trendelenburg position.

detailed_description.textblock: Mannitol has been frequently used for renal protection during surgery. Optic nerve sheath diameter is used to evaluate intracranial pressure noninvasively. Robot-assisted laparoscopic radical prostatectomy can induce an increase in optic nerve sheath diameter due to Trendelenburg position and carbon dioxide insufflation. We therefore aim to evaluate the change in optic nerve sheath diameters before and after mannitol administration in patients who undergo robot assisted laparoscopic radical prostatectomy.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in optic nerve sheath diameters
primary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes after pneumoperitoneum and Trendelenburg position, 90 minutes after mannitol administration during pneumoperitoneum and Trendelenburg position
primary_outcome.description: Change in optic nerve sheath diameters before and after mannitol administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in optic nerve sheath diameters
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes after pneumoperitoneum and Trendelenburg position, 60 minutes after mannitol administration during pneumoperitoneum and Trendelenburg position
secondary_outcome.description: Change in optic nerve sheath diameters before and after mannitol administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in optic nerve sheath diameters
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes after pneumoperitoneum and Trendelenburg position, 30 minutes after mannitol administration during pneumoperitoneum and Trendelenburg position
secondary_outcome.description: Change in optic nerve sheath diameters before and after mannitol administration
Optic nerve sheath diameter before mannitol administration
Optic nerve sheath diameter after mannitol administration

intervention.description: The mannitol has been administered routinely to prevent renal dysfunction in patients undergoing robot-assisted laparoscopic radical prostatectomy. Participants will receive the mannitol as part of routine medical care, and we will evaluate the change in optic nerve sheath diameters before and after mannitol administration.

study_pop.textblock: Prostate cancer patients who undergo Robot-assisted laparoscopic radical prostatectomy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- prostate cancer patients undergoing robot assisted laparoscopic radical prostatectomy.
- 20 year old or above, 79 year old or below.
- agreed to participate this study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of cerebrovascular accident.
- history of congestive heart failure.
- history of pulmonary edema.
- history of anaphylaxis to mannitol.
- conversion to open prostatectomy.
- combined with other operation.
- inability to measure optic nerve sheath diameter.
